metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17533 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mat_VarReadNextInfo4 in mat4.c in MATIO 1.5.17 omits a certain '\0' character, leading to a heap-based buffer over-read in strdup_vprintf when uninitialized memory is accessed. It was discovered that MATIO incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmatio2 - 1.5.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libmatio package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
libpdl-io-matlab-perl package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
mldemos package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
